title: Japanese Curry
directions: Chop potatoes and soak in cold water.
Cut the meat into bite size pieces, season with salt and black pepper.
Press the “Sauté” button on your Pressure Cooker and heat 1 Tbsp oil.
When the oil is shimmering, add the onion, minced garlic and ginger. Saute for a couple minutes.
Add the meat to the pot and stir to coat with oil.
Add carrots and potatoes to the pot and mix well.
Add broth until it's just below the top of the ingredients.
Place the curry roux evenly on the top of the ingredients.
Cover and lock the lid. Make sure the steam release handle points at “sealing” and not “venting”.
Use the "Meat/Stew" button and adjust the time to 20 minutes.
Let the pressure release naturally (takes about 15 mins).
Add the ketchup and soy sauce, then stir well to ensure everything is incorporated.
Place over a bed of rice and enjoy.
ingredients: 3 packages (~8 oz total) Japanese curry roux
